definition: variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
yes, that's right/variant of 似的[shi4 de5]
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
